definition: the act of attributing something, the ascribing of a work (as of literature or art) to a particular author or artist
an ascribed quality, character, or right
examples: Supernatural powers were attributions of the gods.

definition: the interpretive process by which people make judgments about the causes of their own behavior and the behavior of others
examples: Psychologists have long documented what they call the fundamental attribution error, the tendency for people to explain human behavior in terms of the traits of individual actors, even when powerful situational forces are at work.
